Build ID: M20060921-0945

Steps To Reproduce:
1. create FormEditor
2. add FormPage using method 
public void addPage(int index, IEditorPart editor, IEditorInput input), to cause MultiPageSelectionProvider creation
3. open editor

More information:
MultiPageSelectionProvider and FormEditorSelectionProvider in method getSelection() in some cases return null. But as I know such methods always should return empty ISelection.
As a result method pageChange of MultiPageEditorPart, throws exception, in line:

if (outerProvider instanceof MultiPageSelectionProvider) {
					SelectionChangedEvent event = new SelectionChangedEvent(
							selectionProvider, selectionProvider.getSelection());
................

because SelectionChangedEvent doesn't allow null selection.

Stacktrace:

org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert$AssertionFailedException: null argument;

I've updated MutliPageSelectionProvider to never return null.

Moving to User Assistance for FormEditorSelectionProvider.
PW
I was able to reproduce the problem in FormEditorSelectionProvider and have fixed it to return StructuredSelection.EMPTY instead of null.
